refnamediv.refpurpose: The Asterisk system allows for the monitoring of calls which are then saved to a file in a specified format. The Asterisk Manager class enables you to start and stop monitoring instances by specifying a channel and output.

example.title: Start Monitor
example.programlisting:
<?php
    // Having already initialized your AsteriskManager class as $astman
    // We set variables for recording.
    $channel    = "SIP/233";    // SIP handset 233
    $filename   = "recording";  // Into file "recording"
    $format     = "wav";        // In WAV format

    try {
        // Begin recording
        $astman->startMonitor($channel, $filename, $format);
        
        // We're recording for 20 seconds
        sleep(20);

        // Now we stop
        $astman->stopMonitor($channel);
    } catch(PEAR_Exception $e) {
        echo $e;
    }
?>
example.para: Once the monitoring has stopped a new file named "recording.wav" will have been created in your Asterisk monitoring directory.
